item.title: The timing of the 3-way temporary traffic lights on the A46 & Kidnappers Lane is dreadful with waits of more than a minute., 26th October
item.description:
All 3 sets of temporary lights (2 on the A46 Shurdington Road & 1 on Kidnappers Lane. The construction firm need to be instructed to adjust the timing to gaps of no more than 30 seconds to improve the flow of traffic (currently far worse than it could/should be).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement tarmac does not meet with our boundary fence, 26th October
item.description:
We recently moved into 177 Hatherley Road and have had to remove a hedge which fronted the property as it had grown out of control and parts were dead. We are replacing the hedge with a fence along the front boundary. When the pavement was previously tarmacked it was only done up to the overgrown hedge and now the hedge has been removed, this leaves a large gap between the new fence and the tarmac. This could be a trip hazard as the pavement is used constantly. We reported this earlier and the pavement to the east side of our driveway was fixed (looks like a temporary fix as the tarmac is being eroded by footfall already ) but the pavement to the west side of the driveway was overlooked by the surveyor. ie, no white lines were painted on the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 180, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
